    ================================================
                                                CITY HALL

Review No.  86

Wes M. and many other Yelpers have reviewed about the beauty of this monument, history, how to get married, pay your taxes, get your passport,  permits, attending "hot" meetings with the Supervisors and Commissioners, etc.  

Here is my view as a volunteer 6 hours a week for 6 months at City Hall for a Supervisor.  When you first enter the office, you will be greeted by either the volunteer or intern (who usually cannot answer your questions) because nobody knows. (We are advised to tell callers or visitors to telephone 311 or 211, depending on the information needed).  Only the Legislative Aides (who schedules and the watchdog for the office).  The desk is litter with brochures (some are outdated) of community activities within the district.  The Aides supplies information  only "as needed".  Each Aide has their own files and information and sometimes they share it.  As a volunteer, you screen the telephone calls and give the messages to the Supervisor's Aides to decide how to dispatch it.   The Proclamations are written by the person designated to rewrite the information of the "honoree".  The volunteer would go to the Clerk's Office where the City's Official Seal is and use the embosser with a gold seal (some Supervisors use a red/white & Blue ribbons to accent the Proclamation.).  Then, the Supervisor would sign the official paper.  If other Supervisors are to sign the document, then the volunteer is to go to all the offices to obtain their autograph.  And, we have a log sheet of constituents who visits or calls in.  There's more but this should suffice for now.  Over and Out.
author: Marian G.

description: My company had their holiday party here, and it was a wonderful venue! So many pillars, and the grand staircase, with a beautiful paper-crane studded Christmas tree at the top of the staircase. The lighting was wonderful, and the decor was stunning. There was so much space-- 2 large side rooms, a back hall (complete with comfortable lounge seats), a second floor with a great view of the activities below (and a lovely raised area perfect for a wine bar), and a 3rd floor which was used for pro-photos. Perfectly wonderful in every way!
author: Alissa B.

description: I came here last night for a legal function and wow, the hall was surely grand and beautiful. I can't believe I've lived in SF for this long and never ventured inside... the only complaint is that the acoustics are kinda echoey.   Maybe it was only how they set it up last night, but I sat on the main level and it was hard to hear! I do like how when you rent it out, you have the upstairs and side rooms...it's pretty impressive!
author: Natalie S.

description: Near the entrances are signs for "100 Pies" and I searched and searched and never did find a single pie, let alone 100 Pies
author: Pax, Formerly Known As Rufus D.

description: Rich with history SF City Hall is such a beautiful building that I've enjoyed spending time in for holiday parties, wine tasting events and networking/corporate parties. Some people are lucky enough to even get married here. The Rotunda and grand staircase are breathtaking. Truly spectacular.
author: Abby W.

description: Bring your out-of-town visitors here. It's beautiful! When the same-sex marriages were happening here a couple years ago, I stopped in to check it out (with my mom and her husband who were visiting from RI). I stayed for a long time, teared up, and felt so proud to live in San Francisco.
author: Abby W.

description: We do have a really sweet City Hall here in San Francisco. The architectural detail is really damn impressive. History and mythology echo throughout.  Highly recommend taking the free walking tour, call to find out when that is.  Flex your civic muscle and drop in to your Supervisor's office and say hi. Following in the footsteps of former Supervisor Matt Gonzalez, District 5 Supervisor Ross Mirkarimi hosts a free monthly art opening every 3rd friday from 5-8pm. This is one of the few times you can get hammered on government wine in the house of the people.
author: Eddie C.

description: The upgraded and much improved City Hall is beautiful and is definately one of thee spots to bring visiting family/friends. I've been here for weddings, parties (luncheons), court hearings, Mayor's office, and other business/work related reasons and did not have one bad experience with the facilities or staff. The golden dome definately stands out and makes for a great photo op right on the steps of the entrance. They also offer tours seeing as how i've spotted crowds of children in the halls. I can't say it's the most happening place in the city, but if you want to witness something historical, then this is the place. If you're lucky enough (or unlucky, depending on whether or not you care for the Mayor), you'll spot him giving a speech in the main area. Coming here for Valentine's Day was very interesting. There was a line of couples getting ready to get married.
author: Veronica H.

description: This architectural treasure makes the State Capitol in Sacramento look like a hot dog cart, er, schintzel vagon (for now).
author: Andy R.

description:
When they renovated City Hall they won Merit Awards for the lighting, which they had to transport fixtures from Paris in order to keep the 'historic feel'. Apparently only foreign countries have that 1915 Gold Rush look. I can't help but wonder how many homeless could have been cared for in lieu of those expensive fixtures.
Hey, we're a world class city though, and someday somebody will know it because they'll find the time capsule planted in 2001. Thanks to Slick Willie it proves how classy SF keeps it: PlumpJack wine, a Fairmont menu, the Dead Man Walking Opera program, one of da mayor's fedoras & something from the Symphony. 
Wait! We're also a diverse & open minded community, so there's something from the Mexican Museum, a piece of the AIDS quilt, a certificate from the domestic partner ceremony and a 'Chinese plaque'.
To round out the capsule we also have reminders of our hits and misses: 3Com Park memorabilia, closing day of the (old) DeYoung, planned Int'l terminal at SFO & a Pokeman card.
A place can rack up a lot of history in 92 years. A lot of marriages have happened here: thank you Marilyn Monroe & Joe DiMaggio! 
It does happen to be a gorgeous building, inside & out & I've been lucky enough to plan events here, transforming the interior into exotic and amazing environments for expensive nights of good times. Just don't think about drinking red wine on those marble floors!
author: Colleen B.

description: Beautiful building.  I love walking through here on my breaks from Jury Duty.  The architecture is impressive.  It's a great tourist stop for your visitors.  You may even see Gavin Newsom wander by, if you're lucky.
author: Honey L.

description: How can I not be an amazing fan of city hall as it is where I got married to my wonderful wife!
author: Michael C.

description: We got married here, and had a fabulous experience. Everyone we dealt with, from top to bottom, was so wonderful and easy to work with during the entire experience. It goes without saying that the venue was beautiful. A must see if you come to San Francisco.
author: Juan R.

description:
City Hall makes me want to abandon the notion of a Catholic wedding and run down the steps after a sweet, intimate ceremony.

I love the fact that people run out of here with full wedding dresses on...it gives me such a wonderful opportunity to turn to my boyfriend and say "if only there was a sign we should be getting married..."

By the way, what do they do here?
author: A W.

description: We had our wedding ceremony and reception all in the rotunda of SF City hall a few weeks ago, and it was BEAUTIFUL.  If you plan to have a wedding there, I cannot emphasize enough how important it is for you to get uplighting and a couple of spotlights.  It makes the grand interior of the building look that much more grand! You are guaranteed to love it.  It does, however, all come with a price... to rent out the rotunda for a 6pm-11pm event, it cost us roughly $13k including the cost of City Hall security guards.  There are a lot of restrictions, being a historic government building, but the event coordinating staff are very easy to work with.  Once again, I highly recommend this venue for those of you looking for a wedding location!
author: Mikolo R.

description:
5th tallest dome in the world. 
one of the best examples of the french renaissance in america
biggest building to not be touching the ground 
willie brown blew a bunch of money putting real ass bling on the dome
scene of a gnarly double killing
the mayor who started the building of it, tagged it stone age style (got people to engrave his name in the building after hours) above the main rotunda.
kool building
author: jeff e.

description: I am born and raised in San Francisco, yet I've only stepped foot into City Hall for the first time last month, even though I work a few blocks away...am I deprived or what?!?! This place is like a big castle..its BEAUTIFUL!!! must see! (doesnt this sound like an advertisement? hey..its free!)
author: M W.

description: Mayor McDreamy's office is in here. One day he and I can get married here. Oh wait for a sec I forgot I'm straight. Oops sorry about that.
author: Ben L.

description: We have one hell of a City Hall, I must say.
author: Thomas M.

description: We got married here on August 8, 2008, and it was awesome.  Although there were tons of couples getting hitched that day, everything was streamlined and went very smoothly.  We got a very private, lovely spot on the mezzanine overlooking the great hall.  The civil ceremony was perfect for us, and our families and photographer were there to enjoy it as well.
author: youssarian w.

description: This is truly an amazing architecture and boosting an even more beautiful interior. Been here in the past for the famous Black and White Ball event as well as several other fashion show events. Every time walking up and down the grand staircase, I feel like I'm strutting my stuff and channeling the catwalk of Paris or Milan but only this is the City Hall of San Francisco!
author: Yan M.

description: It's gorgeous..... came here on NYE for their donovan party via some gratuitous tix and had so much fun!! Different colored lighting inside at night makes it even prettier.
author: Kelley N.

description: My company had an event here and it was gorgeous. Perfect place for, especially, a large-scale event in the city. Our liaison, Elsie McAteer, was extremely helpful, friendly and especially skilled at handling celebrities/dignataries.  Hard to believe after staging an event there that this place is a working City Hall during the day!
author: Sarah H.

description:
a beautiful & great city landmark for the greatest city in the world.

lots of people get married at the rotunda where there's a staircase that seems like it leads to heaven...

i'm lucky in that i work across the street and get to see this place, or visit this place, every day =)
author: Ray R.

description: I think San Francisco has one of the most beautiful city halls in the world and it made coming here last week to get my marriage license seem even more special. We had an appointment at 8 in the morning and it was super quick and easy. They are very fast and efficient here and it was great to see people actually getting married while we were there. It was so sweet and meaningful and I felt like it was really what marriage was about not these huge events that weddings have become. If I could have another chance to plan my wedding I would have picked City Hall and a nice small dinner afterwards with close friends.
author: Cathy T.

description: One of the most beautiful buildings in the city.  Have your wedding pictures taken at the rotunda!  You won't regret!
author: Mavis G.

description: A great place to elope!  We had a beautifully simple elopement here on Friday.  What a great back drop to our special day!!   YIPPEE!
author: Eileen R.

description:
-beautiful architecture
-great for events like weddings or parties
author: Candy T.

description: Beautiful!  I actually look forward to going to my internship knowing that it is here.  The atmosphere is so nice that I don't even get annoyed with people blocking up the stairs to take pictures haha.
author: Jenn F.

description:
HA
Soooooo.......
Alas i will begin.
I like City Hall. Until last night I had never ventured inside the joint... They throw some sweet parties!
Totally crashed this seal/mammal event thing last night after ours. I had two or three blue drink things and a couple glasses of champagne. I really shouldn't have been drinking last night, i was already hung over from the night before at zeitgeist and hot tubing. But that damn intern was soooooooo cute. I couldn't resist...??? right??? I mean come ON. So we get the intern to come out and "play" after hours..... that's another story
so back to the point... i digress.
we put up this art show of children's art in the mayor's office.... it is open to the public and will be on display until well, the next two weeks. Then we will have the art show. Patti, the entertainment and culture person for the mayor ROCKS MY WORLD. she was amazing so fun and funny, i want to be her when i get old. dude and i met the dead's publicist from the 60s and 70s....dude last night rocked..... i had a lot of fun running around city hall
oh is he straight if his navel is pierced???
author: o. c.

description: Tell me, who in the hell would say "GAWD. CITY HALL IS SO LAME! I HATE IT!" No one. It's awesome and beautiful and I work across the street from it everyday! Yeee
author: Dustin H.

description: Used to work here as an intern when I was 16. By gosh, it was the best experience ever. To be sure, the building took my breathe away.
author: Deepa S.

description: Most beautiful city hall in the history of mankind.  When you come here, be sure to visit ALL the rooms/statues/meet all the politicians that you possibly can. Most people are extremely generous and the building itself (along with the history it's tied to) is just place amaaaazing! SF City hall should be on the list of 100 places to visit before you die.. I love it THAT much & more!
author: Ashley M.

description: I actually got married here a couple of years ago.  I think that the City Hall building is one of the prettiest in SF.  It looks great when it is all lit up as well.  Especially when it was Orange for our good old World Champion Giants.  I like to go inside when I walk by and take a trip down memory lane.
author: Anthony Y.

description: funny to review city hall, but our experience getting married here was just so beautiful - we had a bigger family deal in mexico, but this was for legal needs and still just a beautiful experience. and then there is the whole thing of how you'll always run into willie - which is just too cool.
author: Casey W.

description: Yay for Connie C. I'm all about the intimate morning ceremony on the rotunda--it's where I married my husband the morning of the first day it was legal! Everyone (on staff) was super nice and helpful, and it was the best location I could've hoped for for a ceremony. City Hall has a special place in my heart.
author: Ramon E.

description: An amazing example of a grand builing in the beaux arts style of France.  Amazingly represents the rebuilding of San Francisco after the 1906 earthquake.  I look at this building every day as I wait go the GGT Bus # 10 on my way to work in Sausalito...It's a beautiful and very important structure in our city...
author: Francis K.

description: What a gorgeous venue! For a morning ceremony, this gorgeous landmark can be yours for only $4,000!!  It's a 2-hour package, but you can add on additional hours for a small fee.
author: MeLuvCookie M.

description: Absolutely beautiful.  I can think of nothing more appropriate for one of the greatest cities in the United States.  Luckily for me we had our senior prom in the rotunda of the building and my god it was beautiful.  Almost makes me wish that I enjoyed my senior prom.  You almost forget that it is a city building, yes it is that pretty.  I love this place.
author: Anna H.

description: We've got a pretty cool City Hall.  Gorgeous building. At least Willie Brown spent some of the surplus cash of the late 90s on refurbishing this old building.  Just wish they wouldn't lock the Van Ness doors so early....
author: H.A. ..

description:
City Hall is so beautiful. From the outside, it reminds me of a palace or something.

The palace of Gavin Newsom........
author: Nicole R.

description:
I came here a few weeks ago for the Seventh Annual Monte Carlo Casino charity auction hosted by the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society. This place was soooo packed! The lower level where the lobby is was where they had most of their food. They had food from local favorites such as Yoshi's and a bunch of other places I could not for the life of me remember. They had a lot of different types of food including Japanese, Italian, American, Indian, Thai, Mediterranean, and probably something I'm forgetting to mention. There were bars everywhere you turned mixing cocktails and pouring beer. Because we had VIP bracelets, we were allowed to go upstairs to the second floor where we had a private bar and this awesome sushi that totally kicked Yoshi's ass downstairs. We were munching on these all night and even got to do lots of exploring around City Hall after hours. I think this was the coolest part. We took loads of pictures and went up and down the elevators and hallways. We probably weren't supposed to be up there, but nobody stopped us! I must say I will never forget this experience. The City Hall looks awesome at night, btw!

Final Verdict: I was lucky enough to be able to attend this event, the invitation must be heaven sent! We ran up and down the city hall stairs, we had been drinking all night so we didn't care.
author: Florence W.

description: Beautiful setting for an event! Been to a wedding and my company Holiday party. Both were spectacular!!
author: Rachel S.

description: if you're in the area and need to use a public restroom, this is the place for you!  if you can hold it long enough to get pass the metal detector.  oh and by the way, it's pretty beautiful inside too.
author: Pickle R.

description:
civic center! great lawn to take a break and mellow out on.. it always makes me dream of the day when civic center is the capitol of the great nation of san francisco. let's do it people. california is great, but it doesn't seem like we're all ready to break off of the US like we should. there are a million reasons why california should be it's own nation, but i'll let you do your own research on that. i think it's time that our neighborhoods become cities (they're definitely varied enough) and our city become the nation that it already is.

(long rant) PS it's awesome that they have solar panels on the roof now. my only complaint is why wouldn't you let me in (to buy a muni pass) with my skateboard!?! "you mean i can't even leave it here with you?" "i won't hold you responsible if it gets stolen" (me to the security guard) "nope you can't leave anything here and you can't go in there with that".. damn it! i'm trying to do a good thing here. i'm using alternative (pollution-free) transportation to go get my public transit pass. how more "green" could i be?!?!? anyways, i know the dude was just doing his job, it's just a terribly stupid rule. luckily the new MTA office was open on van ness and i had my board with my. the minus one star is for not allowing skateboards. (what? did you want me to add another car to our heavily trafficked streets and drive?? sorry, i don't do that. i'm actually down to IMPROVE san francisco not DESTROY it.) recognize alternative forms of transportation fuck oil!
author: Pflip W.

description: city hall looks really nice.  i like the way all the buildings in the area are set up  with the open area in the middle for people to walk around and hang out.  also great when they have special events located here...
author: charlotte s.

description: SF City Hall is a beautiful place. Don't want a big wedding? Don't want to head to Vegas? For a small fee, the rotunda is one of the most gorgeous places to hold a civil ceremony.
author: Lyn G.

description: I think we have the best City Hall in America.  Ok, I haven't seen them all but damn, this place is just amazing and I love when they have events there.
author: Misti L.
